newsitem.title: USA: Fraud charges crucial to Columbia/Tenet merger - WSJ.
newsitem.headline: Fraud charges crucial to Columbia/Tenet merger - WSJ.

text.p: As Columbia/HCA Healthcare Corp and Tenet Healthcare Corp discuss plans to merge, the question of how to value Columbia has become crucial, The Wall Street Journal said.
In Thursday's edition, the paper said Columbia may have to pay a major fine to settle possible fraud charges.
Federal investigators have been looking into possible Medicare fraud at Columbia.
Citing "people familiar with the situation," the paper said Columbia and Tenet are discussing a structure that would have Tenet purchase the much-bigger Columbia.
While Tenet holders might end up owning a minority of the combined company, Tenet managers would lead the new entity, the article said.
Tenet could be the surviving name under this scenario, the paper said, and such a transaction would likely put in jeopardy the position held by Richard Scott, Columbia's chairman and chief executive.
